thread.title: Casio Debuts PRO TREK Timepiece with Triple Sensor Version 3 Technology
thread.title_full: Casio Debuts PRO TREK Timepiece with Triple Sensor Version 3 Technology

title: Casio Debuts PRO TREK Timepiece with Triple Sensor Version 3 Technology
text:
Casio Debuts PRO TREK Timepiece with Triple Sensor Version 3 Technology   14, 2015 at 5:01 AM Casio America, Inc. is thrilled to announce the latest addition to its widely popular outdoor activity line of timepieces â€“ the PRO TREK PRW6000SYT-1. Casio Introduces Sleek, New Pro Trek Timepiece 
This state-of-the-art timepiece is the next generation of the PRW6000 line and is designed with a sleek black IP solid titanium band, blue IP stainless steel bezel and is highlighted by a Sapphire glass dial which makes it easy to take from the boardroom to the great outdoors. The PRW6000SYT-1 is also equipped with a variety of features including Smart Access, Triple Sensor Version 3 Technology and more. 
"At Casio, we are always looking for ways to enhance and update our timepieces in order to give our customers the best possible product in the marketplace," said David Johnson, Vice President of Casio's Timepiece Division. "Thanks to new design features, like the Sapphire glass and the Titanium band, the PRW6000SYT-1 is both stylish and extremely durable and versatile, so users can take it wherever they go." 
Designed with Casio's Triple Sensor Ver. 3 Technology, the PRO TREK PRW6000SYT-1 provides users with extremely accurate readings to help navigate through any terrain. The PRW6000SYT-1 is equipped with a direction sensor, as well as an altimeter/barometer and thermometer enabling the user to effortlessly check necessary information on outdoor conditions. One-touch triple sensor technology allows for quick access to measurement readings. With one tap of the direct compass button, the second hand will immediately point magnetic north. This model also displays compass readings with 60-seconds of continuous measurement. Additionally, the watch's barometric sensor alerts the wearer to sudden changes in pressure readings. 
Another key feature is Casio's Smart Access function, which allows for fast and intuitive access to all of the timepiece's functions giving the adventurer an easy-to-use tool when on the go. Furthermore, with Casio's Tough Solar Power technology, users can charge the timepiece in low or fluorescent light, eliminating the need for continuous battery replacement. 
Other key features of the PRW6000SYT-1 include: 100M Water Resistance World Time (29 cities + UTC) Full Auto Double LED Light with Afterglow STN LCD Display
